Package org.dyn4j.geometry

This package contains geometric objects used by the collision detection package.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Convex
    Represents a Convex Shape.
    Shape
    Represents a geometric Shape.
    Transformable
    Represents an object that is Transformable.

    Represents an edge feature of a Shape.

    Represents an ellipse shape.

    Represents a feature of a Shape.

    Contains static methods to perform standard geometric operations.

    Represents a half ellipse shape.

    Represents a numeric Interval.

    Represents Mass data for an object about a given point.

    Represents a 2x2 Matrix.

    Represents a 3x3 Matrix.

    Represents a Convex Polygon.
    Ray
    Represents a ray.
    Rectangle
    Represents a Rectangle (either axis aligned or oriented).

    Represents a line Segment.
    Slice
    Represents a section or slice of a Circle shape.
    Transform
    Represents a transformation matrix.
    Triangle
    Represents a Triangle.
    Vector2
    This class represents a vector in 2D space.
    Vector3
    This class represents a vector in 3D space.
    Vertex
    Represents a point on the edge of a Shape.
    Wound
    Represents an object that is defined by vertices, and has counter-clockwise winding.

Package org.dyn4j.geometry Description

This package contains geometric objects used by the collision detection package.

Includes many classes used by all portions of the library primarily for representing geometric objects.

The Convex interface and subclasses and Vector2 class are the main focus for this package.

All concrete implementations of the Convex interface are available for use in the collision detection system and by extension the dynamics system.

Current supported convex shapes:

  • Circle
  • Polygon both concrete class and base class for Rectangle and Triangle
  • Rectangle polygon with more efficient methods than its base class
  • Triangle polygon with more efficient methods than its base class
  • Segment special case shape; take care when using this class
To add more Convex Shapes extend the AbstractShape class.

All shapes can be constructed using their respective constructors or via the Geometry class. This class gives other options that make generating specific types of shapes easier and safer. It's recommended to use the methods contained in this class instead of the shape constructors.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
2.2.2
Author:
William Bittle
